For starters, we would need to know:

a) the full log generated for running a single session (try deleting the
existing one and running Eclipse again)
b) which build you are using (will be included in the log)
c) more details on observable behavior, for instance, are any error dialogs shown?

Please reopen when you can provide this information.

b)

3.0.1 for Mac OS X.

c) "An error has occurred.
See the log file
"/private/Network/Servers/files.starmark.com/Users/bcirce/Applications/eclipse/configuration/
1104861846339.log".


All of our computers use Network Home Directories off of our Apple XServe, making all the computers 
essentially identical, and we can login to our home from any machine.

Let me know what else you need. Thanks.

See the message buried in the log:

"An error occurred while locking file "/private/Network/Servers/files.starmark.com/
Users/bcirce/Applications/eclipse/configuration/org.eclipse.core.runtime/.manager/.fileTableLock":

"Operation not supported". A probably reason is that the file system or Runtime
Environment does not 
support file locking. You may want to choose a different location, or disable
file locking (using the 
osgi.locking property)..."

You will have to disable the use of Java NIO file locking. To do that, you can
edit the config.ini file and add:

osgi.locking = none

Or specify the property when running Eclipse, as a VM argument:

eclipse [all Eclipse args] -vmargs -Dosgi.locking=none

*** This bug has been marked as a duplicate of 44735 ***

causedBy.message: An error occurred while locking file "/private/Network/Servers/ files.starmark.com/Users/bcirce/Applications/eclipse/configuration/org.eclipse.core.runtime/ .manager/.fileTableLock": "Operation not supported". A probably reason is that the file system or  Runtime Environment does not support file locking. You may want to choose a different location, or  disable file locking (using the osgi.locking property), but this can cause data corruption.
